decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes efficient removal like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, along with counter spells like Counterspell and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also runs card draw spells like Archmage's Charm and Consider to ensure it has the necessary resources to outlast the opponent. With powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Otawara, Soaring City, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent until it can secure a win.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells with cards like Counterspell and Spell Snare, while also efficiently removing threats with Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Narset, Enlightened Exile allows the deck to generate additional value from spells cast earlier in the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while maintaining consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on using the combo of Underworld Breach and various cards like Twiddle, Hidden Strings, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate infinite mana and repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard. Consign to Memory and Wish provide ways to manipulate the graveyard and access key pieces, while cards like Sink into Stupor and Consider help with digging for combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a stream of powerful spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using rituals and mana generators like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while also utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Ruby Medallion to reduce the cost of spells. The ultimate goal is to combo off with Past in Flames, allowing for a massive spell chain to be cast from the graveyard. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help to dig for combo pieces, while Wrenn's Resolve provides protection. The deck also includes some removal and land options for flexibility.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler provide massive threats, while cards like Through the Breach and Kozilek's Command offer versatility in how to play them. Ancient Stirrings and All Is Dust help find the necessary pieces to win, with lands like Eldrazi Temple and Grove of the Burnwillows fueling the deck's mana needs. The inclusion of cards like Kessig Wolf Run and World Breaker offer additional ways to close out the game or deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on an aggressive strategy with a combination of creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes the companion mechanic with Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional value. The deck includes both low-cost aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, as well as versatile removal spells like Thoughtseize and Galvanic Discharge. The mana base is built around fetching dual lands with cards like Marsh Flats and Bloodstained Mire to ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, the goal is to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells and disrupting your opponent's strategy. The key card, The One Ring, provides additional control and power to the deck. By utilizing cards like Force of Negation, Counterspell, and Supreme Verdict, you can stall your opponent while setting up your win condition. Additionally, cards like Tune the Narrative and Subtlety give you the ability to manipulate the game in your favor. Overall, the deck aims to outlast your opponent and grind out a victory through careful planning and precise decision-making.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells and removal spells, while using The One Ring as a win condition. By using a combination of disruption and powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. The deck also includes cards like Subtlety and Galvanic Discharge to maintain board control, along with card draw and manipulation with cards like Meticulous Archive and Tune the Narrative. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game and grind out victories through resource management and efficient plays.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and quickly dealing damage to the opponent. It also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Goblin Bombardment and Blood Moon. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, while using control elements to maintain the upper hand in the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana generation and card draw to build up enough resources to combo off and deal a large amount of damage quickly. The key strategy involves playing spells that reduce the cost of casting other spells, enabling you to chain together a series of powerful spells to win the game. By efficiently generating mana and drawing cards, you can create explosive turns that overwhelm your opponent and secure the win. The inclusion of Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish helps provide additional support and flexibility to the combo strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays to overwhelm opponents. The deck includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, supported by damaging spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Goblin Bombardment provides additional tactics for victory. With a mix of creature power and spell removal, this deck aims to quickly build a dominant board presence and deal damage efficiently to secure wins in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and control spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain advantage. It includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler, as well as control spells like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to control the board. The deck aims to efficiently ramp into its big threats using cards like Eldrazi Temple and Through the Breach, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Sowing Mycospawn. It seeks to dominate the game with its powerful creatures and control elements.

This deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to quickly generate mana for powerful cards such as Karn, the Great Creator and All Is Dust to control the game. It also includes Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and World Breaker to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence while also disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming control and powerful threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command provides additional utility and flexibility in dealing with various threats.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Grief, Boggart Trawler, and Orcish Bowmasters. Utilizing cards like Necrodominance, Soul Spike, and Not Dead After All to help maintain board presence and deal direct damage to the opponent. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Fell the Profane provide additional threats and disruption, while Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help control the opponent's resources. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also utilizing graveyard interactions and disruption to secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly and aggressively building up a board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. It also utilizes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to push through damage and control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and additional mana acceleration to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly through aggressive creature-based strategies with a splash of burn and control elements.
